snippet: After a string of close calls in their 51-season history, Johan Santana finally finished the job in the Mets’ 8,020nd game.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column celebrates the first no-hitter in the history of the New York Mets, thrown by pitcher Johan Santana in the team's 8-0 victory over the St Louis Cardinals; notes that Mets fans have waited 51 seasons, or 8,019 games, to witness the event.
lead_paragraph: After a string of close calls in their 51-season history, Johan Santana finally finished the job in the Mets’ 8,020nd game.

headline.seo: In Mets’ 51st Year, Finally, Their First No-Hitter
headline.main: In Mets’ 51st Year, Finally, Their First No-Hitter
headline.print_headline: For Mets and Santana, Wait for No-Hitter Is Over
